column4: can't I just download mplayer the easily way from their pages, and the install? Which one of these? MPlayer v1.0rc1 source, MPlayer 1.0rc1, Windows MPlayer 1.0rc1, Windows GUI [MPlayer OS X 1.0rc1 Fedora Core RPM packages
the easy way is to enable multiverse and install it with your favorite package manager in ubuntu
ok, but what's ya mean about 'enable multiverse'?
system -> administration -> software sources
did you manage to enable multiverse?
the first tab of Software Sources has several checmarks.  One of them corresponds to Multiverse.  Do you see it?  mplayer is in multiverse, that's why you need it
i suggest is gonna be off, cause it was on.
it's supposed to be on
ok. and now?
now go to a terminal and type: sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude install mplayer   (this way we can be sure without using a gui)
is it finnish now? :pV
yes
the player looks just like it was before i installed it.. I don't even see the streaming.
you asked how to install mplayer.  What are you trying to do then?
I'm conna see this little clip
if you want to install the plugin for your browser, then you need to install "mozilla-mplayer", remove whatever your current plugin is (probably totem-mozilla), and restart your browser
and you may or may not need w32codecs as well
apt-get install mozilla-mplayer ?
yes, and remove totem-mozilla.  I have to go now, but that should do it.  If you still need help, Paddy_EIRE seems to understand the issue and is always helpful :)
Paddy_EIRE: did your video not work after installing mozilla-mplayer, removing totem-mozilla, and installing w32codecs?
